content.description: Start at the bottom of this arete, with feet on either side, and compressed on the lowest slopers of each side. Start bumping or slapping to top out a mere 3 feet above your head. Surprisingly fun for the distance!
content.location: Drop down the hill from the Winter Wall or Cock Bloc area. When heading down from the Winter Wall, this long head-height boulder falls lengthwise, perpendicular to the slope several hundred yards downhill and skier's left.

content.description: Start on the finger jug/rail on the right side of this protruding horn, using any manner of heel and toe hooks to move under and around the block, to top out on the wall to the left. Tricky but fun. Transitioning to the wall may be the most difficult and least fun moves.
content.protection: Single pad is okay, though tricky to place. A spotter is not a bad idea due to the tricky nature of the problem.
content.location: This is the protruding block that can be seen while walking the cliff line towards Winter Wall.

content.description: On approaching the Winter Wall, you'll pass several shorter blocky sections of rock that hold a couple problems. The Compression Problem is also downhill of here.
